title: The item changes are the first time I've ever actually felt sad at a Riot change.
body:
http://puu.sh/l1sG1/132184bcea.png
http://puu.sh/l1sov/1392f01001.jpg

Not because of balance. Not because of blatant ADC favortism shown again... 

But rather just the fact they took BC and Trinity, and tried to force them in to ADC builds. They took the few items that bruisers actually still had and try actually build damage with, and pushed them to ADCs.

I just don't understand it. Riot is giving ADCs some of the most grossly OP items the game has ever seen, and in addition to that they try to take away the items that melee champions use and mold them in to ADC items? You look at trinity and go "Well Jax, Irelia, Hecarim, etc. REALLY enjoy low damage on-hit builds with attack speed... but... I mean Corki wants CDR and crit chance..." You look at BC and you go "well BC is a very efficient item for melee champions with high base damage... but... ADCs don't want as much health, and they want more damage..."

Does my enjoyment of the game really matter so fucking little to Riot at this stage? Has the push for #LCSBIGPLAYS and ADCs running around murdering everything in team fights really outpaced my fun? You can't just make them new items, but you also have to give them away my items too?

What's worse is pushing crit chance so heavily on trinity just means that of the 3-4 auto attacks I get on a ranged champion I'll have so much of my item's power shoved in to pure RNG. The 10% crit chance used to take so little of the item's budget, but now you're taking away it's AP, you're taking away AD, you're taking away attack speed, and you're boosting CDR and crit? How many rat's asses do you think I give about CDR and crit on Jax? And when I play Olaf how many rat's axes do you think I give about 25 more damage? That lower price point and 100 more HP is what mattered. Who gives a fuck about 25 more damage? Same for Darius.

It's like someone kicked me out of my own house to throw ADCs another birthday party.

This basically hits the nail on the head of the purpose of the changes. They weren't driven by forcing them into the hands of Marksmen but rather were due to some of our efficiency changes. The gross oversimplification is that item efficiency is going to be slightly lower across the board (and more equal across items), but players will generate gold at a faster rate.  

When looking at Black Cleaver, we wanted to make sure it was slot efficient and damaging enough to serve as a Juggernaut's core offensive item.  

Trinity Force has changes from the aforementioned efficiency sweep and from and cleaning up fighter component items.  For a decent amount of time we were testing a Trinity Force that excluded Zeal and did extra physical damage on hit.  Feedback wasn't great on it, as it just didn't feel like it spiked as it did before.   Zeal, and thus crit, were added back to the recipe.    

There are a number of projects besides Marksmen being worked on for the Preseason and we'll be engaging in discussions about them more as the patch approaches.

You didn't add crit back to the recipe. You emphasized it. You shifted the power focus towards its crit chance, away from the stats that bruisers find more desirable. 

Why is that?

Then where is the ability power? Why did you nerf the movement speed? Why did you lower the attack speed? Why did you increase the critical strike chance something that most bruisers have no reason to buy unless they are doing some really weird off build?  Which class does like crit chance?  If you guessed ADCs you are correct.  This is just simply obvious adc bias and stats that bruisers and some assassins like are being nerfed/removed in exchange for more crit which neither of those classes like at all.

Same for Black Cleaver.  You're nerfing the health which Bruisers care about a lot whereas ADCs don't and making it more expensive in exchange for more attack damage which ADCs care a lot more about than bruisers do.  Again, more bias towards ADCs and more nerfs to the Bruisers and Assassins that really like this item.  You're already giving ADCs a fuckton of items in preseason.  Why take these away as well for them?
And yet the new Trinity force seems to be less efficient on champions like Mordekaiser, skarner and similar bruisers :/

I'm curious why you say that, looking at the new trinity it seems like the only major loss is the ability power.

But for most bruisers/tanky champs the cdr should far outweigh the minor damage they got from the ap on trinity, and with more spellblade procs as well it seems to me like a better item.

Maybe its just me but I highly incentive cdr on tanky champions because living longer means cdr has more time to give me additional ability casts per fight, and often just one additional ability cast will end up being the equivalent of a ton of ad or ap.

Because it lost AP, Attack speed and attack damage in exchange for Crit, which is basically the Adc stat, and CDR which many current Trinity users dont care about much.

EDIT: and movement speed too, which melee champions consider an important stat.

I just think people are really over reacting to this. 5 less ad isn't going to break anyone. 15% attack speed is practically the same damage boost as 10% crit, especially when you consider that attack speed only boosts a champions base attack speed but crit boosts the entire damage dealt. Admittedly champions who rely on auto attack enhancers do lose out a small bit of power here but if you aren't buying a BotRK its pretty much a neutral change.

AP and MS are two legitimate losses, that being said I cannot think of an AP champion who actually prefers Trinity over Lich Bane. Help me here I cannot think of a champion that truly cares that trinity is losing ap.

CDR will always matter and I am confused why you think that Trinity users, who deal quite a bit of damage through spellblade procs and thus very much care about using abilities consistently, will not like the cdr. 

All in all I predict that people who use trinity now will continue to use it, bar some other newer item proving to be the perfect fit for the bruiser types taking its place, and will hardly notice the difference.

Jax and Irelia both have good AP ratios and really enjoyed ms and as over crit since NEITHER of them are going to be building more of it so it is still unlikely you will get a crit. Both of which really don't care for the cdr either since they typically hit 40% easily without the unnecessary boost so it is more or less a wasted stat.

Mordekaiser doesn't build Trinity? It costs too much for wasted stats.

Mordekaiser doesn't need Crit, AD, Attack Speed, or Mana. I'm not sure why anyone would think this is a good item on him.

AD, as he obviously has huge scaleings, AS as it helps to get  his 3 Qs out faster, MS to reach targets, health for getting beefy, and trinityprocs for the champ with the highest base AD...seriously, trinity offers all and beyond off what morde would want, so it doesn't matter if the crit and mana are somewhat wasted.
I like building it due to the 340 damage sheen procs D_D

ever tried including a recursive bow instead of zeal? 

what feels good for bruisers is the AS-part right now, as i makes animations smoother - which is fairly important for melees that only have short windows to get their attacks of. What they really wouldn´t need though is winning trades by fucking RNG. and you just added a lot more of that. Have fun feeding a kill to Irelia due to a tripple-crit with trinity-rush and then getting stomped like no tomorrow without doing anything wrong.
You keep seeing those issues with IE rush bot...and your solution is to globalize the problem and add it to toplane? that´s a fcking joke. Next thing is you´re gonna introduce Chaos Knight as a new Champion (because mages really should have access to RNG aswell! why would we want to keep the game remotly competitive?).

can´t say how brutaly dissappointed i am with this presseason.
Yup! Bow was our replacement for Zeal. It was received very poorly in testing, unfortunately.  It seems to make a lot of sense on paper but once you're in game it feels pretty darn lackluster.
I feel this is one of those things you should push to the PBE and let players see. Triforce as it is now is really bad, you've at least got to show the alternatives.

well...thanks for half a reply i guess (though i honestly would be far more interessted in why on earth you´re making a game that should be competitive more RNG based instead of less so than into details i lack context for proper evaluation).

well sure, as an item itself bow sucks - zeal feels a lot more impactfull to have since it´s not only raw-dmg stats but also shiny numbers (a crit every now and then) and most importantly MS. Soo...did a trinity without Crit, but everything else the old one had feel bad in testing? or was it just the rather boring bow compared to zeal?

Edit: and after giving it some thought...if bow seemed too boring for most players, why not just use stinger instead? trading crit for cdr and a little AS would be everyone´s dream on trinity and each of the components would still feel satisfying...
